p: Meningitis is another bacterial disease considered by WHO as an emergency, although also caused by fungi and viruses, the most frequent cause is bacterial. Neisseria meningitidis and Streptococcus pneumoniae are the largely responsible for the threat to public health related to this disease. Meningitis has high morbidity due to the inflammatory response resulting from their passage through the blood-brain barrier causing inflammation in the meninges and brain edema, leading to neurological sequelae in this disease survivors ( 34, 52, 53).
